posts.title: A Wrinkle in Time Throughout Time
posts.text: In celebration of A Wrinkle in Time 's theatrical film premiere, The New York Public Library is taking a look at the visual evolution of the science-fantasy classic.

posts.title: NYPL Shares New Children's Album NYPL Sings
posts.text: The New York Public Library just released an album for children called  NYPL Sings. This ten song album was a true collaboration from Library staff to bring children, caregivers, and librarians a fun and free way to expand their early literacy practices.

posts.title: Curator's Reading List for You Say You Want A Revolution: Remembering the 60s
posts.text: Curator Isaac Gewirtz shares a counterculture reading list for the exhibition You Say You Want A Revolution: Remembering the 60s, open January 19 - September 1, 2018.

posts.title: A Sotto-Voce Proposal in the Library's Rose Main Reading Room
posts.text: New York Times bestselling author, Catherynne Valente, gets engaged in the Library's Rose Main Reading Room.
